summary: DT:  THE CONTACT STATES THE FRONT CAP OF THE TRAILER WAS SEPARATING.  HE SPOKE WITH THE MANUFACTURER, AND THEY SUGGESTED THAT  HE TAKE THE TRAILER TO THE DEALERSHIP.  THE FIRST DEALERSHIP STATED THE CAP NEEDED TO BE REPLACED AND IT WOULD COST $7500.  THE SECOND DEALERSHIP STATED THEY COULD FIX IT.  THEY TOOK IT APART, AND FOUND THAT OUT OF ALL THE SCREWS THAT SHOULD HAVE BEEN THROUGH THE CAP AND SIDEWALL THERE WHERE ONLY ABOUT FIVE AND  THROUGH BOTH PIECES.  THEY HAD TO REATTACH THE CAP THAT WAS ONLY BEING HELD ON BY THE SEALANT AND THE FIVE SCREWS.  *AK
